p: The mean values of TPC in turmeric rhizomes of different varieties are shown in Table 2. These multiple means comparison results revealed that TPC of Bonga 51/71 and Dame varieties are not significantly different from each other at the 5% level of significance. The two highest TPCs were found in Dame (97.55 mg GAE/g) and Bonga 51/71 (96.52 mg GAE/g), whereas the lowest was found in HT3/2002 (83.21 mg GAE/g). This difference among varieties is in line with a previous study by Tanvir et al. (2017) who reported that different turmeric varieties cultivated in Bangladesh gave different TPC. A similar pattern was obtained in Japan ( Akter et al., 2019) where the minimum (37.9) and the maximum (157.4) mg GAE/g TPC were obtained from a methanolic extract of C. aromatica and Ryudai gold turmeric varieties, respectively.
